espnscrapeR 0.2.1
  • Reference

Scrape ESPN FPI ratings for a specific season from ESPN's site

Source: R/scrape_fpi.R
scrape_fpi.Rd

Scrape ESPN FPI ratings for a specific season from ESPN's site

scrape_fpi(season = 2020, stat = "FPI")

Arguments

season

Either numeric or character
stat

One of 'FPI', 'EFF' or 'PROJ'

Value

Returns a tibble

Examples

# Get team offensive and defensive efficiency from 2020 season
scrape_fpi(2020, stat = "EFF")
#> Scraping EFF for 2020!
#> # A tibble: 32 x 11
#>    season team  w_l   eff_ove rnk_ove eff_off rnk_off eff_def rnk_def eff_spe
#>     <dbl> <chr> <chr>   <dbl>   <int>   <dbl>   <int>   <dbl>   <int>   <dbl>
#>  1   2020 Balt… 5-1      81.7       1    71.8      11    65.3       1    86  
#>  2   2020 Pitt… 6-0      77         2    76.5       7    63.7       2    51.2
#>  3   2020 Kans… 6-1      74.4       3    83.8       2    51.3      10    46.4
#>  4   2020 Gree… 5-1      74.2       4    85.8       1    34.1      19    67.2
#>  5   2020 Tamp… 5-2      70.2       5    70.7      12    62.5       3    45.1
#>  6   2020 Seat… 5-1      66.5       6    79.8       3    41.4      13    61.5
#>  7   2020 San … 4-3      64.4       7    66.7      15    57.1       4    43  
#>  8   2020 Los … 5-2      64.3       8    72.9      10    55.8       5    31.8
#>  9   2020 Indi… 4-2      63.3       9    58.4      22    55.7       6    65  
#> 10   2020 Ariz… 5-2      61.7      10    64.8      17    52.2       9    51.1
#> # … with 22 more rows, and 1 more variable: rnk_spe <int>
